MY DEAR SIR,

I am highly gratified in being permitted to dedicate this Volume to you, one of the most dis- tinguished Pupils of our common Master‚ Samuel, sometime Lord Bishop of Lichfield.

I had the good fortune to commence my aca- demical career under your Tuition before higher duties called you from Trinity College. My recol- lections of that period, and more enlarged experience since, assure me that I cannot usher this Edition into the world under more favourable auspices than the sanction of your name: and I most gladly em- brace the opportunity now afforded me of expressing at once the high esteem which, in common with all,

I entertain towards you, and'my grateful sense of your unvaried kindness.

Believe me to remain, My dear Sir, Ever yours most faithfully, ⁴ RIOHARD SHILLETO.
